comments: PSYC 239 required. A grade of C- or better must be earned in both PSYC 238 & 239 to satisfy the LS requirement.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Psychology 110 and concurrent registration in Psychology 239
summary: Memory is a key foundational component of most human activities. This course will explore different types of memory (working memory, episodic memory, semantic memory, implicit memory, procedural memory), how we encode and retrieve memories, methods of studying memory, memory changes over the lifespan, and applications of this knowledge to day-to-day life (education, law, medicine, advertising). A grade of C- or better must be earned in both Psychology 238 and 239 to satisfy the LS requirement.
title: Memory Processes
